<|ref|>title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 186, 171, 201]]<|/det|>
# PHYSICS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 206, 366, 222]]<|/det|>
Paper 2 Multiple Choice (Extended)  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[90, 247, 590, 291]]<|/det|>
Additional Materials: Multiple Choice Answer Sheet Soft clean eraser Soft pencil (type B or HB recommended)  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 312, 388, 329]]<|/det|>
## READ THESE INSTRUCTIONS FIRST  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 342, 237, 357]]<|/det|>
Write in soft pencil.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 357, 504, 372]]<|/det|>
Do not use staples, paper clips, glue or correction fluid.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 372, 892, 401]]<|/det|>
Write your name, Centre number and candidate number on the Answer Sheet in the spaces provided unless this has been done for you.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 400, 383, 415]]<|/det|>
DO NOT WRITE IN ANY BARCODES.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 429, 892, 459]]<|/det|>
There are forty questions on this paper. Answer all questions. For each question there are four possible answers A, B, C and D.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 459, 890, 475]]<|/det|>
Choose the one you consider correct and record your choice in soft pencil on the separate Answer Sheet.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 488, 556, 504]]<|/det|>
Read the instructions on the Answer Sheet very carefully.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 517, 764, 533]]<|/det|>
Each correct answer will score one mark. A mark will not be deducted for a wrong answer.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 533, 467, 548]]<|/det|>
Any rough working should be done in this booklet.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 549, 359, 564]]<|/det|>
Electronic calculators may be used.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 564, 630, 579]]<|/det|>
Take the weight of \(1.0\mathrm{kg}\) to be \(10\mathrm{N}\) (acceleration of free fall \(= 10\mathrm{m / s}^2\) ).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 72, 96, 89]]<|/det|>
<label>1</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 72, 920, 106]]<|/det|>
A measuring cylinder contains some water. A small metal block is slowly lowered into the water and is then removed.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 116, 920, 150]]<|/det|>
Finally a piece of plastic is attached to the metal block and the block is again slowly lowered into the water.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 161, 720, 180]]<|/det|>
The diagrams show the measuring cylinder at each stage of this process.

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[191, 190, 808, 485]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 282, 349, 301]]<|/det|>
Which statement is correct?

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 311, 134, 330]]<|/det|>
<label>A</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[148, 311, 615, 330]]<|/det|>
At the boundary, the speed of the light will become less.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 338, 134, 356]]<|/det|>
<label>B</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 338, 556, 356]]<|/det|>
The critical angle for light at this boundary is \(50^{\circ}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 364, 134, 383]]<|/det|>
<label>C</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 364, 589, 382]]<|/det|>
The diagram shows an example of diffraction of light.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 390, 133, 409]]<|/det|>
<label>D</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 390, 480, 408]]<|/det|>
The missing ray is a weak reflected ray.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 435, 106, 454]]<|/det|>
<label>22</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 435, 724, 454]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 466, 457, 485]]<|/det|>
The plastic has a refractive index of 1.48.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 632, 376, 650]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 661, 134, 680]]<|/det|>
<label>A</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 661, 180, 680]]<|/det|>
18°

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[280, 661, 303, 680]]<|/det|>
<label>B</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[311, 661, 351, 680]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[475, 661, 520, 680]]<|/det|>
37°

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[615, 661, 636, 680]]<|/det|>
<label>D</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[640, 661, 685, 680]]<|/det|>
42°

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 72, 106, 88]]<|/det|>
<label>23</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 72, 920, 120]]<|/det|>
A sound wave travels from a medium in one state into the same medium but in another state. This causes the speed of the wave to change from approximately \(300 \text{m/s}\) to approximately \(3000 \text{m/s}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 131, 576, 149]]<|/det|>
Between which two states is the sound wave travelling?

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 160, 139, 178]]<|/det|>
<label>A</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 160, 250, 178]]<|/det|>
gas to solid

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 186, 138, 203]]<|/det|>
<label>B</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 186, 255, 203]]<|/det|>
liquid to gas

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 212, 138, 230]]<|/det|>
<label>C</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 212, 263, 230]]<|/det|>
liquid to solid

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 238, 138, 256]]<|/det|>
<label>D</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 238, 263, 256]]<|/det|>
solid to liquid

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 284, 106, 301]]<|/det|>
<label>24</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 282, 920, 316]]<|/det|>
The Moon is \(380 000 \text{km}\) from the Earth. A laser light beam is directed from the Earth to the Moon. The beam is reflected back to the Earth.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 327, 759, 345]]<|/det|>
How long does it take for the light to travel to the Moon and back to the Earth?

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 355, 133, 374]]<|/det|>
<label>A</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 355, 220, 374]]<|/det|>
1.27 ms

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[280, 355, 298, 374]]<|/det|>
<label>B</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[310, 355, 386, 374]]<|/det|>
2.53 ms

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[448, 355, 468, 374]]<|/det|>
<label>C</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[473, 355, 539, 374]]<|/det|>
1.27 s

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[615, 355, 635, 374]]<|/det|>
<label>D</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[648, 355, 705, 374]]<|/det|>
2.53 s

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 400, 104, 420]]<|/det|>
<label>25</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 400, 504, 420]]<|/det|>
Which statement about radio waves is correct?

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 429, 133, 448]]<|/det|>
<label>A</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[151, 429, 534, 448]]<|/det|>
They are used in television remote controllers.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 456, 133, 475]]<|/det|>
<label>B</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[151, 456, 490, 475]]<|/det|>
They can be detected by the human eye.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 482, 133, 501]]<|/det|>
<label>C</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[151, 482, 433, 500]]<|/det|>
They travel as longitudinal waves.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 508, 133, 526]]<|/det|>
<label>D</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[151, 508, 655, 526]]<|/det|>
They have the same speed in a vacuum as ultraviolet waves.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 551, 106, 570]]<|/det|>
<label>26</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 551, 539, 570]]<|/det|>
The diagram shows the Earth and its surroundings.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 581, 625, 600]]<|/det|>
Through which labelled region can sound **not** be transmitted?

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[160, 606, 833, 907]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 72, 107, 89]]<|/det|>
<label>27</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 72, 395, 89]]<|/det|>
Different waves travel through air.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 101, 549, 120]]<|/det|>
Which waves have the greatest difference in speed?

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 129, 134, 147]]<|/det|>
<label>A</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 129, 450, 147]]<|/det|>
ultrasound waves and sound waves

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 156, 134, 174]]<|/det|>
<label>B</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 156, 477, 174]]<|/det|>
ultrasound waves and ultraviolet waves

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 183, 133, 201]]<|/det|>
<label>C</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 183, 425, 201]]<|/det|>
ultraviolet waves and light waves

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 210, 133, 227]]<|/det|>
<label>D</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 210, 432, 227]]<|/det|>
ultraviolet waves and radio waves

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 254, 106, 272]]<|/det|>
<label>28</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 253, 705, 272]]<|/det|>
A train of steel nails and a train of iron nails hang from a strong magnet.

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[303, 280, 692, 382]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 392, 571, 411]]<|/det|>
The trains are then carefully removed from the magnet.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 422, 351, 441]]<|/det|>
What happens to the trains?

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 451, 134, 469]]<|/det|>
<label>A</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 451, 324, 469]]<|/det|>
Both trains fall apart.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 478, 133, 496]]<|/det|>
<label>B</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 478, 361, 496]]<|/det|>
Both trains stay together.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 504, 133, 522]]<|/det|>
<label>C</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[151, 504, 455, 522]]<|/det|>
Only the train of iron nails falls apart.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 530, 133, 549]]<|/det|>
<label>D</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[151, 530, 463, 549]]<|/det|>
Only the train of steel nails falls apart.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 574, 104, 592]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 574, 554, 592]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[151, 682, 447, 700]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 725, 106, 744]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 725, 393, 744]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 755, 568, 772]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 784, 134, 802]]<|/det|>
<label>A</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 784, 242, 802]]<|/det|>
\(\alpha\) -particles

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 811, 133, 828]]<|/det|>
<label>B</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 811, 232, 828]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 838, 133, 856]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 838, 230, 855]]<|/det|>
neutrons

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 865, 218, 882]]<|/det|>
protons

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 72, 106, 88]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 72, 720, 89]]<|/det|> Identical cells and identical resistors are used to make the circuits shown. <|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[304, 98, 687, 280]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 299, 420, 316]]<|/det|> In circuit 1, the ammeter reads 2.0A. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 330, 457, 346]]<|/det|> What is the ammeter reading in circuit 2? <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[111, 357, 134, 375]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 357, 198, 375]]<|/det|> 1.0A <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[280, 357, 311, 375]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[320, 357, 364, 375]]<|/det|> 2.0A <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[450, 357, 475, 375]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[480, 357, 531, 375]]<|/det|> 4.0A <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[616, 357, 641, 375]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[648, 357, 698, 375]]<|/det|> 8.0A <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 402, 106, 420]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 402, 920, 435]]<|/det|> The diagram shows a circuit with a fixed resistor connected in series with a thermistor and an ammeter. <|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[411, 444, 589, 603]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 613, 920, 647]]<|/det|> Which row shows how temperature change affects the resistance of the thermistor and the current in the circuit? <|ref|>table<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 658, 646, 803]]<|/det|>

thermistor		current in circuit

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 72, 107, 89]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 72, 697, 91]]<|/det|> The diagram shows an AND gate and an OR gate connected together. <|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[304, 98, 690, 185]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 197, 621, 216]]<|/det|> Which combination of inputs X, Y and Z gives an output of 0? <|ref|>table<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 227, 361, 355]]<|/det|>
XYZ
A001
B011
C100
D110
<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 382, 106, 400]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 382, 920, 416]]<|/det|> The diagram shows a short-circuited copper coil swinging about an axis at right-angles to a strong magnetic field. The motion induces a current in the coil. <|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[272, 425, 724, 694]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 707, 603, 726]]<|/det|> What is the effect, if any, of this induced current in the coil? <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 737, 134, 755]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 737, 920, 771]]<|/det|> The induced current has no effect on the movement of the coil because copper is non-magnetic. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 777, 134, 795]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 777, 813, 795]]<|/det|> The induced current produces a magnetic field of constant magnitude in the coil. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 803, 131, 821]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 803, 730, 821]]<|/det|> The induced current produces forces that assist the change causing it. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 829, 133, 848]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 829, 752, 848]]<|/det|> The induced current produces forces that oppose the changes causing it.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 72, 106, 89]]<|/det|>
<label>38</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 71, 728, 91]]<|/det|>
Radioactive carbon-14 decays to nitrogen-14 by the emission of a particle.

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[398, 101, 601, 123]]<|/det|>
\[{}^{14}_{6}\mathrm{C} \rightarrow {}^{14}_{7}\mathrm{N} + \mathrm{particle}\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 138, 520, 158]]<|/det|>
Which particle has been emitted in this process?

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 168, 141, 186]]<|/det|>
<label>A</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[151, 168, 248, 186]]<|/det|>
a \(\beta \)-particle

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 196, 138, 214]]<|/det|>
<label>B</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[151, 196, 260, 214]]<|/det|>
an \(\alpha \)-particle

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 222, 138, 240]]<|/det|>
<label>C</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[151, 222, 233, 240]]<|/det|>
a neutron

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 248, 136, 266]]<|/det|>
<label>D</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[151, 248, 225, 266]]<|/det|>
a proton

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 293, 106, 312]]<|/det|>
<label>39</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 292, 920, 327]]<|/det|>
As \(\alpha\)-particles pass through the electric field between two charged plates, they are deflected downwards.

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[232, 335, 761, 448]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 464, 645, 484]]<|/det|>
What happens to \(\gamma\)-rays passing through the same electric field?

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 494, 133, 512]]<|/det|>
<label>A</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 494, 625, 512]]<|/det|>
They are deflected downwards more than the \(\alpha\)-particles.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 521, 133, 539]]<|/det|>
<label>B</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[151, 521, 390, 539]]<|/det|>
They are deflected upwards.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 548, 133, 566]]<|/det|>
<label>C</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[151, 548, 390, 566]]<|/det|>
They are not deflected at all.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 575, 133, 593]]<|/det|>
<label>D</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[151, 574, 524, 593]]<|/det|>
They follow the same path as the \(\alpha\)-particles.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 618, 104, 636]]<|/det|>
<label>40</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 618, 920, 653]]<|/det|>
Radioactive iodine-131 emits \(\beta\)-particles and has a half-life of 8 days. It decays to produce xenon-131.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 663, 490, 682]]<|/det|>
Which statement about this decay is correct?

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 693, 133, 711]]<|/det|>
<label>A</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 693, 520, 711]]<|/det|>
After 8 days no more \(\beta\)-particles are emitted.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 720, 133, 737]]<|/det|>
<label>B</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 720, 623, 737]]<|/det|>
After 8 days the number of xenon-131 atoms has halved.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 746, 133, 764]]<|/det|>
<label>C</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 746, 598, 764]]<|/det|>
After 16 days the iodine-131 has decayed completely.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 772, 133, 791]]<|/det|>
<label>D</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 772, 764, 791]]<|/det|>
After 16 days the number of iodine-131 atoms has reduced to one quarter.
